::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(haven)
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
TEDS_2016 <- read_stata("https://github.com/datageneration/home/blob/master/DataProgramming/data/TEDS_2016.dta?raw=true")

#Tondu vs Unification
ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(Tondu)) +
  geom_bar(aes(weight = Unification)) +
  labs(x = "Tondu", y = "Unification")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](assignment2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


At first glance, it is difficult to identify trends because a lot of the variables are binary (i.e. sex, party, whitecollar).

Missing values can be handled by omitting the NA values.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Tondu vs female
ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(female)) +
  geom_bar(width = 0.5, aes(weight = Tondu)) +
  labs(x = "Sex", y = "Tondu") 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](assignment2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Tondu vs DPP
ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(DPP)) +
  geom_bar(width = 0.5, aes(weight = Tondu)) +
  labs(x = "DPP", y = "Tondu")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](assignment2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Tondu vs age
ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(age)) +
  geom_bar(aes(weight = Tondu)) +
  labs(x = "Age", y = "Tondu")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](assignment2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-3.png){width=672}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(income)) +
```

```{.r .cell-code}

ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(edu)) +
```

```{.r .cell-code}
table(TEDS_2016$Tondu)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

  1   2   3   4   5   6   9 
 27 180 546 328 380 108 121 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
TEDS_2016$Tondu<-as.numeric(TEDS_2016$Tondu,labels=c("Unification now”,
“Status quo, unif. in future”, “Status quo, decide later", "Status quo
forever", "Status quo, indep. in future", "Independence now”, “No response"))

#Tondu Frequency
ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(Tondu)) +
  geom_bar() +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=c(0:10)) +
  labs(y = "Frequency")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](assignment2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-9.png){width=672}
:::
